items.body: Nature, Published online: 17 December 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03820-z Video-call glitches might seem harmless, but they can reduce peopleโs chances of getting hired, closing a business deal or following a doctorโs recommendation. Human brains expect video calls to feel like in-person conversations. When glitches break that illusion, it feels unsettling and strange, harming judgements of trustworthiness, likeability and credibility.
